intro: Tripleurospermum trichophyllum, commonly known as the woolly hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
